actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tiffany amendment No. 93.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Tiffany,  numbered 93 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to strike funding for the removal of roads that are no longer needed.
On agreeing to the Tenney amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 92.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 92 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for Executive Order 14019, relating to Promoting Access to Voting.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 91, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 91.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 91 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to reduce the salary of the Chair of the Council on Environmental Quality Brenda Mallory to $1.
On agreeing to the Stauber amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Stauber amendment No. 90.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Stauber,  numbered 90 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit any funds from being used to expand the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness.
On agreeing to the Stauber amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Stauber amendment No. 89.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Stauber,  numbered 89 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit any funds being used to designate the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness as a national monument under the Antiquities Act.
On agreeing to the Stauber amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Stauber amendment No. 88.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Stauber,  numbered 88 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to ensure States and other cooperating entities that provide search and rescue services on Federal lands can receive reimbursement.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 85, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 85.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 85 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds made available by this Act to be used for environmental justice activities.
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 84.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 84 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit the EPA from redesignating the Permian Basin as in nonattainment for ozone.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 83, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 83.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 83 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to eliminate funding for the Council on Environmental Quality and moves the funding to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 82, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 82.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 82 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit the use of funds for the EPA to take any "backstop" actions related to the Chesapeake Bay TMDL.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 81, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 81.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 81 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit the use of funds to give formal notification under, or prepare, propose, implement, administer, or enforce any rule or recommendation pursuant to, section 115 of the Clean Air Act.
On agreeing to the Palmer amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Palmer amendment No. 80.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Palmer,  numbered 80 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds from being used to implement, administer, or enforce the final rule entitled "National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants: Lime Manufacturing Plants Technology Review".
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8998 — "Making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
Mr. Palmer asked unanimous consent that the proceedings had during the recess be printed in the Congressional Record. Agreed to without objection.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on July 24, 2024, at 11:53 a.m.: That the Senate passed S. 3696 and H.R. 1076.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 24.
The Speaker announced that the Joint Meeting was dissolved. The House remains in recess subject to the call of the Chair.
The House convened in Joint Meeting with the Senate to receive an address by His Excellency Benjamin Netanyahu, Prime Minister of Israel.

The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. Pursuant to a previous order of the House, the House will reconvene for a Joint Meeting with the Senate for the purpose of receiving His Excellency Benjamin Netanyahu, Prime Minister of Israel. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8998 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Simpson moved that the committee rise.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 148
actions-list.actionItem: 267, 1 Present (Roll no. 390).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Harshbarger amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 174
On agreeing to the Brecheen amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 211

actions-list.actionItem: The body observed a moment of silence in memory of Officer Jacob J. Chestnut and Detective John M. Gibson of the United States Capitol Police who were killed in the line of duty defending the Capitol on July 24, 1998.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Brecheen amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 156

actions-list.actionItem: On agreeing to the Palmer amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Palmer amendment No. 79.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Palmer,  numbered 79 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit the EPA from using funds to arm agents as part of the agency's criminal enforcement division.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 78.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 78 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds to be used by the Environmental Protection Agency for the U.S. Global Change Research Program.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 77.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 77 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds for the Environmental Financial Advisory Board of the Environmental Protection Agency.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 76.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 76 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds to carry out the provisions of section 50262 of Public Law 117-169 (Inflation Reduction Act).
On agreeing to the Obernolte amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Obernolte amendment No. 75.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Obernolte,  numbered 75 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit any funds made available by this Act from being used by the Environmental Protection Agency to approve a waiver for the California Air Resources Board's In-Use Locomotive Regulation.
On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Miller (IL) amendment No. 73.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Miller (IL),  numbered 73 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for the rule titled "Control of Air Pollution From New Motor Vehicles: Heavy- Duty Engine and Vehicle Standards."
On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Miller (IL) amendment No. 72.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Miller (IL),  numbered 72 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for the Environmental Protection Agency's Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Workgroup.

At the conclusion of debate on the Miller (IL) amendment No. 57, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Miller (IL) amendment No. 57.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Miller (IL),  numbered 57 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to reduce the salary of Ya-Wei (Jake) Li, Deputy Assistant Administrator for Pesticide Programs, to $1.
On agreeing to the McCormick amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the McCormick amendment No. 56.

An amendment, offered by Mr. McCormick,  numbered 56 printed in Part B of House Report 118-602 to reduce funding for the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Environmental Programs and Management account by $7 million and redirect $5 million to the EPA OIG for increased oversight of the EPA.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8998 — "Making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Cline to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Keith Self to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
